Description:
At Halter, we're unlocking the connection between humans and animals, starting with cows and then expanding to other animals. Passionate about revolutionising farming, our world-first technology helps farmers break free from the time-intensive constraints of conventional farming and empowers a more sustainable future for farmers, their cows and our land. Halter is giving farmers the freedom to spend more time with their families, the technology to increase production and meet the growing demand for food and the data to help them care for their cows, which we know is paramount for farmers.

To find out more, visit our careers website, LinkedIn & Instagram.

About the role

Each day we process millions of points of telemetry data from animals across the country on our customer farms. Our rich datasets and deep industry knowledge allows us to build market-leading models that continuously monitor and predict animal behaviour. The insights we provide transform the way farmers manage the... health and movement of their animals.

We are looking for a data scientist who can build models to predict animal behaviour and extend the way we apply data science across all areas of the business. We’re looking for people who are hungry to make an impact, are comfortable in a fast-paced environment, and love helping the people around them succeed.
What your day could look like

• Collaborating with data engineers, software developers and product managers to build models for behaviour classification, animal guidance, and pasture management
• Building models, while considering risks, opportunities, and technical debt
• Running experiments to explore areas where insights and predictions, powered by data science, could add value to our teams
• Staying up to date with the state of the art in data science tools, techniques, models, and design best practices
• Working as part of a cross-functional team, contributing to your teammates’ success, and encouraging collaboration and task sharing
• And finally, as this is a start-up, you’ll be rolling up your sleeves and helping with whatever is required to succeed in our mission, knowing that the whole organisation is with you doing the same

What we’re looking for

• A solid track record working as a data scientist, with examples of outcomes you’re proud to have delivered
• A comprehensive understanding of the fundamentals and design systems behind building reliable, scalable and fit-for-purpose machine learning models and infrastructure
• Strong experience in Python and familiarity with development in a backend tech stack
• A strong understanding of data engineering best practices and AWS infrastructure
• Experience working in agile development practice, in a cross-functional development team
• Understanding of common development processes such as version control, continuous integration/delivery, code reviews, and pair programming
• Someone who is product oriented and cares about customer experience, being able to solve real-life customer problems
• Evidenced-based reasoning and decision-making and the ability to make trade-offs against real-world constraints
• Someone that takes responsibility for their projects and delivers complete work

Why our team loves working at Halter

• A genuine and shared connection to our mission to make a difference in the world.
• The excitement, risk, and reward of a high-growth technology scale-up.
• The pride of joining an iconic New Zealand technology company growing successfully on the global stage.
• The opportunity to work with and grow alongside a dynamic, and highly talented team with diverse backgrounds.
• The opportunity to supercharge your career in a supportive and caring environment.
• Our ideas are truly valued, we are able to move fast, and our impact is real.
• State-of-the-art, dog-friendly office that’s been thoughtfully designed right in the heart of Auckland city.
• Delicious snacks and drinks are available for your daily flow.
• Healthy body, healthy mind. We’re partnered with Southern Cross to support your well-being.
• We offer 6 months of fully paid parental leave for primary caregivers, 4 weeks of fully paid secondary caregiver and many other parental benefits that support you and your family.
• Our personal growth is important. Halter offers an annual $1000 self-development budget to be used for anything that fuels personal growth.
• Our time to recharge is valued, we’re offered wellness leave & unlimited paid annual leave.
• Importantly, we offer a competitive remuneration package made up of salary, benefits and an employee stock ownership plan.

Halter is committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive workplace — a place where we can each be ourselves and do the best work of our lives. Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the requirements, women and under-represented groups of candidates tend to only apply when they meet every requirement. If you think you have what it takes but don’t necessarily tick every requirement on this job description, please still get in touch and apply to Halter. We’d love to chat to see if you’ll be an epic fit!

If this opportunity sounds like you, please apply below by sending through your cover letter explaining why you’re excited about this role and working at Halter, along with your CV, and we’ll be in touch!

Please also feel free to check out the careers and culture page for more information on working at Halter and don't forget to follow us on LinkedIn & Instagram

Description

Employment Hero is an Australian tech unicorn - valued at over $1.25 billion.

Our world-class software is the easiest way for small and medium-sized businesses to manage HR, payroll, employee engagement, and benefits. We’ve grown 100% year-on-year since our inception in 2014, and now service over 90,000 businesses and 850,000+ active users globally. We have exciting growth plans for 2023 and beyond, powered by our mission of making employment easier and more valuable for everyone.

We take a Remote First approach with our team. Employment Hero can hire across the world, so long as candidates have eligible working rights and are in a suitable timezone to their colleagues. If you’ve got the skills for the role and the passion for our mission then we want to hear from you!

About The Lead Data Scientist Job

Employment Hero is continuing to innovate and grow, and have now opened a new opportunity for a Lead Data Scientist who can join us and be foundational in establishing... a Data Science function.

As our Lead Data Scientist, you will leverage our wealth of data gained through our broad Human Resources and Employee Experience products, developing new Machine Learning (ML) models, building advanced analytics and insights, whilst growing and developing a team of data professionals.

You’ll have an impressive challenge ahead of you, where you’ll provide sophisticated insights and intelligence, including for commercial use cases to our sales, marketing and product teams on customer trends and opportunities, and also to inform and build products for our clients where we can continue to make employment easier for small and medium sized businesses around the world.

We’re moving fast, and often build the plane while flying, we’re looking for someone who isn’t afraid to start running from day 1.

Some Of Your Responsibilities Will Include
• Design, develop, maintain and manage our data warehouses /data lake
• Build advanced Machine Learning / Analytics models
• Work with our product and engineering teams to use your ML initiatives, including developing products
• Be our data steward - own our governance, be a data security evangelist
• Coach, mentor and develop a small team of Data Analysts in Data Science
• Provide advice and work directly with our Chief Product and Technology Officer (CPTO) to scale the data function into the future

About Your Experience, Skills And Abilities
• Experienced as a Lead or Senior Data Scientist within a product lead technology business, including experience in ML for revenue generation
• Deep hands-on experience with creating Machine Learning models from scratch and getting them into production
• A passion for and confidence in Data Governance and stewardship
• An experience or desire to manage and develop a team
• Solid ability to code in Python, SQL, R

Nice To Haves But Not Essential
• Masters or PhD in a relevant field
• Experience with ETL or systems integration projects

Some Of Our Benefits
• Remote-first! With flexible working arrangements.
• Participate in our Employee Share Options Program - you’ll be a part owner of Employment Hero
• 20 days vacation leave, plus 1 Leisure Rules day a year
• Self, health, wealth and happiness programs
• We set you up for success with the latest and greatest hardware, tools and tech + a generous budget to spend on setting up your home office (if you need a desk, chair, screen? You name it!)
• Budgets towards continuing your learning and other generous allowances
• International annual company conference (Last conference we went to Phuket, Thailand!)
• Refer friends to open jobs and receive a cash bonus for every successful referral you make
• Virtual yoga classes
• Our Sydney office is dog friendly and remains open for team meetings, collaboration days and those who need a day away from their home office (we are a COVID-safe workspace for those who choose to use it)

We celebrate diverse perspectives and experiences, and we celebrate and invite people of all backgrounds and identities to apply for this position.

Why join Employment Hero?
• Raised $181M achieving unicorn status in February 2022
• LinkedIn Top 25 Startups 2021, ranked #2 in Australia
• The Australian Top 100 Innovators List 2021
• Raised $140M Series E round led by Insight Partners July 2021
• Raised $45M Series D round led by Seek 2021
• Deloitte Technology Fast 50 2020, ranked #42 in Australia
• LinkedIn Top 10 Startups 2020
• Raised $22M Series C Round led by Seek July 2019
• Raised $8 mill series B round led by Seek and OneVentures
• Deloitte Technology Fast 50 2019, ranked #20 in Australia
• GetApp Category Leader Q1 2019
• Deloitte Technology Fast 50 2018, ranked #12 in Australia
• HRD Gold Medalist - Human Capital Management Systems 2018
• HRD Gold Medalist - Rewards and Recognition Service Provider 2018
• HRD Rewards and Recognition Employer of Choice 2018
• LinkedIn Top 25 Startups 2018
• EY Entrepreneur of the Year National Finalist 2018

#ANZSG

Senior AI Engineer

Department: Engineering

Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time

Location: Auckland, New Zealand

Reporting To: Konstantinos Raptis
Description

Who are we?

The team at Imagr is growing and it's an exciting time to join us! Imagr is leading the charge in automated retail technology with our end-to-end, AI powered checkout solution. Our goal is to revolutionise modern retail and make life easier for everyday people, with no checkouts and no queues.

Things all of our Imagr team do

Imagr’s core values are really important to us, and speak to what we believe makes the experience with Imagr so unique. We use them to guide our behaviours, both within our team, and with the rest of the big wide world.
• We make magic happen. We seek opportunities for extraordinary innovation in all that we do and challenge ourselves to be better today than we were yesterday.
• We act as one. We play to each other's strengths, value the success of the team over the individual, celebrate... our differences and support each other to bring our whole selves to work.
• We don’t stand still. We move fast, empower our team to have impact and use the data we have to drive direction.
• We are all shoppers. We live and breathe the opportunity our product has to make a global impact on our retailers and shoppers; thinking big, but scalable.

Our core values help us to ensure that we are building a successful company that
provides value to our customers and a great environment for our team.

How does this role fit in?

Your role delivers impact by advancing the functionality of the focal point of our solution: The world’s most advanced, computer vision empowered shopping cart that delivers a frictionless experience for shoppers. You will play a critical role in building and refining this advanced vision system, overcoming challenging technical problems to maintain IMAGR’s best in class offering.

In this role you will be researching and applying a range of software, computer vision and machine learning techniques to enable low-friction solutions to optimize the shopping experience. We have a number of novel challenges in the domains of object detection, segmentation, classification, and model lifecycle and sustainability.

What will your days look like?
• You will lead, mentor and work with the team to design, prototype, evaluate, optimize, implement and deploy CV/DL algorithms as an integral part of AI-powered retail technologies
• You will translate product feature requirements to design inputs / specifications and come up with high-level algorithmic designs to meet requirements and guide design tradeoff decisions.
• You will research and prototype state-of-the-art computer vision and deep learning methods to develop solutions that meet product requirements.
• Develop creative computer vision solutions for our cutting edge AI powered product
• Develop novel, performant solutions around topics like object detection, segmentation and classification
• Apply machine learning to computer vision problems
• Plan and execute cutting-edge research, ensuring that the company stays at the state of the art
• Research and prototype techniques and algorithms for object detection, recognition, few shot learning, and open set recognition
• Collaborate with HW and SW engineers to develop prototype solutions for future generations of our product

The skills we're looking for
• Master’s Degree with 6+ years of relevant industry experience OR 4+ years of relevant industry experience with a PhD Degree
• A postgraduate degree in the field of computer vision, machine learning or similar
• 3+ years experience with computer vision with deep learning. Specifically object detection, segmentation and classification
• 2+ years of experience engineering in Python
• Experience with machine learning libraries such as PyTorch or TensorFlow
• Expertise in machine learning, Bayesian filtering and information theory
• An academic publication in CV/AI conferences/journals such as CVPR, ICCP, ICCV, NeurIPS
• Experience in designing and training and deploying production-grade deep learning architectures for computer vision application with a broad understanding of latest CV / DL methods and literature
• Experience working with edge-based / embedded computer vision algorithms

Engineers at IMAGR:
• Care deeply about helping the team to excel
• Demonstrate empathy for both their users and their coworkers
• Have a hunger for learning and growing
• Take pride in your work, and demonstrate a passion for your craft
• Take the initiative to improve our system, platform and ways of working
• Have energy and enthusiasm for the work you do
• Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
• Self-manage your tasks, time and the expectations you have set
• Share your time and knowledge generously with others and work openly and collaboratively.

What can you expect from us?
Not only do you get to work with a talented and passionate team on a groundbreaking product, but we'll also look after you. We can offer you a competitive salary, a comprehensive wellbeing programme that looks after your mental and physical health, shared lunch with the team on every Friday, and the opportunity to grow your career in a venture-backed tech company growing on an international scale.

At Imagr, we celebrate unique backgrounds and experiences. While facing an exciting range of problems, we need a diverse team to solve them, so put your unique perspective forward and let's see where it takes us! If you're interested in this role, but feel you may not have the exact experience we're looking for, please still consider applying as we're keen to hear from curious, passionate people who are willing to learn

KPMG New Zealand is part of the international KPMG network, one of the world’s leading professional services organisations. We provide audit, tax, and advisory services to individuals, SMEs, not-for-profit organisations, multi-nationals and government agencies.

KPMG Digital Lighthouse is comprised of several specialist chapters who combine to design, deliver and operate cutting edge digital solutions on a variety of architectures, supporting our cross-sector clients to digitally transform their organisations and thrive on a global scale. We are a passionate, inclusive and supportive team who care about our clients, our people and the work we do. Join us today and accelerate your digital career with KPMG.

The opportunity:
• As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for applying advanced analytics to large data sets, developing and applying custom models and algorithms to obtain insights and drive strategic and tactical decisions

Day to day you will:
• Use advanced analytics ... statistical techniques such as predictive modelling, machine learning, clustering and natural language processing to solve challenging business questions in a novel way
• Process and transform raw data, and enrich data by integrating it with disparate data sources
• Review models and algorithms developed by your colleagues or by a client
• Work with clients and stakeholders throughout the organisation to identify opportunities to leverage data and analytics to drive business solutions
• Keep up with latest industry trends and contribute to thought leadership on trending topics that are relevant to our clients

What you'll bring to the team:
• Qualification in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Information Science, or another quantitative field and a strong problem-solving aptitude
• Experience using programming or scripting languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL, Scala etc.) and familiarity withy mainstream data science and visualisation frameworks and tools (e.g., Pandas/NumPy, Scikit-learn, Databricks, Power Bi, Tableau)
• Prior experience preparing data for analysis, building predictive models and machine learning models on large scale platforms, and helping to drive innovation in the modelling process/offerings
• Experience with Cloud Platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS, and/or Google Cloud)
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with proven ability to work with cross-functional teams and bridge technical and non-technical audiences

KPMG New Zealand has a summer shutdown period from the 23rd December 2022 to the 16th January 2023 (inclusive). During this time, please expect a delay in response to any new applications. Most recruitment processes will commence interviewing in February 2023.

Life at KPMG

We offer rewarding careers to talented individuals and a holistic range of benefits to support your life balance, whatever your circumstance. We want you to do Work That Matters, Thrive and Grow and know that you Belong here with us, at KPMG.

As a KPMG employee, we will offer you:

— Access to the firm's annual incentive scheme

— Opportunities for local and international secondments

— Hybrid working across a mix of office, client and home hubs to recognise that people have individual circumstances and preferences when it comes to where and how they work

— A technology starter pack to get your 'home hub' set up

— The ability to work from overseas and extend time connecting with friends and family outside New Zealand

— Flexible leave options, including the ability to purchase additional annual leave.

— Gender-neutral support for all stages of the parental journey, including access to 18 weeks of fully paid parental leave for all new parents

— A paid professional association membership of your choice

— Unlimited digital accreditations through our partnership with Microsoft, LinkedIn Learning, with bespoke learning pathways for all employees

— A wide-range of special offers and discounts on insurances, banking services, and lifestyle goods and services.

— The support, allyship and opportunity to join our many Inclusion, Diversity and Equity Affinity networks, including the Kiwa, Pride, Ethnicity, Accessibility and Wahine groups

— The opportunity to participate in Green Team activities, as we work toward reducing the firm’s environmental footprint and become carbon zero by 2030

— An invitation to join your local Social club and enjoy events aimed at bringing people together for social, sporting, cultural, family and fundraising activities

— Paid time off for volunteering and involvement in citizenship activities

— An array of health and wellness benefits such as free flu vaccinations, subsidised sporting events, free confidential counselling services, additional leave to support you and your family in the recovery from COVID-19, access to our Wellbeing portal with an extensive range of advice and resources and much much more!

We believe that diversity of background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, clients and communities. Our goal is to be recognised as an employer of choice for all, irrespective of gender, ethnicity, generation, flexible work status, family circumstances, sexual orientation or disability. Further info can be found on our website

We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant

Join the data science team at an exciting time of growthExplore modelling and machine learning techniques with large, complex datasetsWellington or Auckland-basedProvide data science, statistical and modelling expertise to help NZTA decision makers and those in the wider land transport sector solve complex problems and challenges. The opportunity | Te Whiwhinga mahi The Data Science team sits in and is part of the Research and Analytics team at the Agency. It aims to provide an evidence base to support and underpin smarter, evidence-based decisions, for NZTA decision makers and those in the wider land transport sector. As part of the Advanced Analytics and Modelling team you will be making a difference to everyday lives of New Zealanders. Working closely with the Transport Agency's delivery groups, you will provide data science, statistical and modelling expertise to solve complex problems and challenges. The role gives you the opportunity to build strong working relationships with... key stakeholders to identify opportunities that would benefit from data science or other advanced analytical techniques. Your relationship with these stakeholders will be key to success and you are seen as a though-leader by providing advice as well as solutions. The team is working in a number of emerging areas including real-time predictions; risk scoring through advanced analytical and modelling techniques; forecasting; modelling transport accessibility; graph analytics; and evaluating the effectiveness of road engineering initiatives. You will be a self-starter who is comfortable working with complex and often challenging data. We are looking for individual with a curious and inquisitive mind, looking to step into a position to explore and create an impact. About you | Ko wai koe To be successful in this role, you will bring: An advanced level of statistical programming (SQL, Python and/or R)Experience in statistical interpretation and complex analysis, including the ability to find stories and insights in dataKnowledge of ETL processes and experience working in a server-based environmentExperience in developing both training and inference systems for machine learning pipelinesComfortable working on cloud environments (preferably Azure)Familiarity with code versioning tools (Git, Github, Azure DevOps)An understand of information security and discretionAn ability to build and maintain relationshipsGood verbal and written communication skillsA relevant post graduate qualification in statistics or another discipline requiring the analysis of complex dataClick here to view the position description. About us | Ko wai mātou At Waka Kotahi, the NZ Transport Agency, it all starts with our people. The organisation's performance and success depends on the people who choose to make this a great place to work and make a difference for Aotearoa. The Transport Agency has a strong future focus, understanding that new technologies and changing customer expectations mean the transport system we know today will not be the one we deliver in ten years time. Along with our other benefits we also have new Waka Kotahi Life, Income Protection and Critical Illness Insurance scheme available for permanent employees. Rā Katinga | Applications close: 2 August 2022For further information, email: careers@nzta.govt.nzTo be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.Waka Kotahi is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). At the Agency we recognise the importance of diversity and inclusion and are committed to providing a working environment that embraces these values. Please let us know if you need any support or have any access requirements that will help you through the recruitment process.Please note that we may begin shortlisting as we receive applications. We encourage early applications as we may withdraw the advertising at any time

Job Description

Professor in Data Science

»
Teach, research, lead and collaborate

»
Lead our computing disciplines in interdisciplinary analytics initiatives

»
Join AUT’s dynamic School of Engineering, Computer and Mathematical Sciences

Auckland University of Technology (AUT)is vibrant, achievement-oriented and a compensateing place to work. Ranked in the top 250 of world universities, Information technology is also one of the world’s top 40 young universities and #1 for global research impact in Australasia. We’re poised for the next stage of growth and offer a stimulating teaching and research environment with strong connections to government, business and industry. AUT has close to 30,000 students and around 3,000 staff across our three teaching campuses and is located in New Zealand’s (NZ’s) largest city,Auckland– consistently ranked as one of the world’s most liveable cities.

OurComputer Science and Software Engineering department (CSSE)is part of AUT’s large, unique... dynamic and interdisciplinarySchool of Engineering, Computer and Mathematical Sciences (ECMS).The department constitutes world-leading research skills in AI/Machine Learning, Networks and Cybersecurity, Software Engineering, and Information Systems, with special emphasis on the discovery and application of expertise. Data Science has been an area of strength where we are expecting significant growth in our programmes and courses. Industry and academic interest in this area is high and is expected to continue to rise, our newData Science majoris part of our BCIS degree and We are seeking to expand to postgraduate offerings in the near future. We host the Data Science Research Group, whom along with other colleagues within the school have active research projects with a range of external stakeholders in the area.

This is an exciting opportunity for a forward-thinking
Professor of Data Science with skills in at least two of the following data science related areas – large databases and data warehousing, artificial intelligence, data mining, machine learning or data visualisation.

Recognising the growth and increasing significance of data across a wealth of disciplines, AUT is looking at pan-university collaboration in analytics as a strategic direction. The appointee would be expected to take a leading function in representing the computing disciplines in these interdisciplinary initiatives. As we continue to grow our programmes, there are also opportunities to guide course development and build interdisciplinary linkages and models.

Other key focus areas include:

» Providing leadership abilities to the Data Science theme, including securing external research grants and leading teams of colleagues and students to achieve high-quality research results (grants, publications).

» Providing leadership abilities to the planning and delivery of applied, innovative and theoretically underpinned Data Science curricula, which would include collaboratively working with internal and external stakeholders.

» Providing leadership abilities to develop the department’s profile both internally and externally for its strengths and innovations in Data Science research and teaching.

You will be recognised as a senior academic who displays attributes of tolerance, empathy, trustworthiness, confidence and kindness. Your capability to listen, connect, collaborate, communicate and influence will be critical – as is your level of strong respect for others coupled with an open and engaging attitude that is flexible to changing requirements. You’ll enhance the positive energy within AUT, value diversity and work inclusively. A resolute, robust and positive attitude is essential.

NOTE: The School of ECMS is also currently advertising for a Head of Department and Professor of Mechanical Engineering to further bolster its academic leadership abilities, clickHEREFor more information.

Applications and Selection Criteria

Please submit a curriculum vitae (including full publication record), cover letter and a statement covering the following
key selection criteria :

» A record of distinguished academic achievement and research appropriate for appointment as a Professor. A PhD/Doctorate is required.

» In-depth expertise of at least two of the following data science related areas – large databases and data warehousing, artificial intelligence, data mining, machine learning or data visualisation.

» Evidence of an consciousness of the growing significance of issues such as security and privacy of data, big data and bias, and commitment to the ethical uses of data.

» International standing in the area of data science research, leading and working within moderate to large size research teams.

» Evidence of curriculum design and implementation.

» Evidence of contributions in the mentoring and the career growth of academic colleagues, especially underrepresented groups

» A demonstrated record of commitment to Te Tiriti o Waitangi and consciousness of New Zealand as a bi-cultural society.

» candidates are welcome to add further comments they may feel of relevance.

more information:

» Start Date: The prosperous candidate will ideally join AUT in February 2022 (or earlier by negotiation).

» A competitive remuneration package will be agreed with the prosperous applicant, commensurate with skills and practice.

» Referees will only be engaged for shortlisted candidates and will not contacted without the prior consent of the applicant. When applying, candidates should provide names, contact details and clarification of relationship for at least three potential referees.

For academic enquires: Contact Professor Aman Maung Than Oo (Head of School, Engineering, Computer and Mathematical Sciences) –aman.oo@aut.ac.nz. For recruitment information: Contact Mike Wood (AUT Executive Recruitment Partner) –mike.wood@aut.ac.nz.

Advertising Closing date: Sunday, 17 October at 23:55pm (New Zealand standard time). We expect interviews to take place during November 2021.

About Us

LightSpeed Studios is one of the world’s most innovative and successful game developers. With team across China, United States, Singapore, Canada, United Kingdom, France, Japan, South Korea, New Zealand, and United Arab Emirates. We are expanding to more countries.

Founded in 2008, LightSpeed Studios has created over 50 games across multiple platforms and genres for over 4 billion registered users. It is the co-developer of worldwide hits PUBG MOBILE, Apex Legends Mobile, and League of Legends: Wild Rift (Chinese Version).

LightSpeed Tech Center is a centralized platform for LightSpeed Studios, including game engine, audio, QA, AI, tech partnership, research & development, and other tech-related teams.

Responsibilities
- Participate in architecture design and coding around building a good AI platform for training and online service.
- Bring AI capabilities to the gaming business by building ML Ops processes.

Qualifications

- Bachelor's degree or above in computer... science, engineering or a related field strongly preferred
- Experience in end-to-end ML implementation，including data pre-processing, feature engineering, ML experimentation, and DevOps principles
- Experience in Cloud native development, including docker, k8s
- An ability to write good code in your favorite programming language (experience with C++/Python/Go may be helpful), and familiarity with common ML frameworks and tools
- Passionate about learning and applying new, relevant technologies

Altered State Machine (ASM) are looking for world-class AI Research Scientists to work on our Core Research Track. We are welcoming applicants from anywhere in the world.

As part of the Innovation team you will work in developing novel deep learning models towards solving and building the next generation of AI generative models. This team will solve the most challenging problems in AI innovation & aim to be first and top of the world.

ASM are creating the world’s first protocol for decentralised and democratised Artificial Intelligence, owned and traded using NFTs, and interoperable across the Metaverse. Our protocol enables anyone to own AI, and the machine learning models that define what it learns over time. These are paired with artwork in the form of NFT's to create non-player agents.

We're creating a world where everyone can own, understand, trust and benefit from their AI. Join us in building the #OpenMetaverse. Help to push the boundaries of future innovation.

Key... responsibilities:
• Design, implement, and evaluate models and software prototypes.
• Report and present research findings and developments, including status and results, clearly and efficiently, both internally and externally, verbally and in writing.
• Work with external collaborators and maintain relationships with relevant labs and partners and key stakeholders as appropriate.

In order to set you up for success as a Research Scientist at ASM, we look for the following skills and experience:
• Ph.D. in a related area, e.g. Computer Vision, Computer Graphics, VR/AR/MR.
• Relevant experience to the position such as post-doctoral roles, a proven track record of publications from conferences e.g. Siggraph, ICCV, CVPR, ECCV, AAAI, NIPS.
• Practical experience in research of AI models, e.g. transformers, diffusion models, VAE/GAN.
• Real passion and experience in AI generative area
• *Please submit your publications when applying.**

We're a great place to work at
• Experienced and wickedly talented team and growing
• Venture funded by a consortium of leading crypto investors… and more every day
• Plenty of opportunity
• Real work-life balance

We can offer
• Great variety (no two days are the same)
• Exciting international projects
• Engaging with global AAA gaming companies, game platforms and investors
• The right salary
• Flexibility with WFH options
• The chance to be part of the next generation of the internet… the decentralised Metaverse

We’re looking for people to help us build the future of AI and gaming in Web3. If the above sounds like you and the idea of new technologies, gaming and the Metaverse excites you, we’d love to chat

We’re a passionate bunch of data lovers and are searching for Senior Machine Learning Engineers to help us grow our ML Capabilities across Australia and New Zealand. At Eliiza we guarantee you will work with other smart, passionate and supportive people to deliver high quality data science and ML outcomes to clients.

Our projects and clients vary a lot - but here’s a typical snapshot of what you could be doing:
• selecting the best technology for a given data science use case
• choosing the best operational architecture for an ML application
• developing ML applications
• applying MLOps principles to data science workflows, e.g. building reproducible training pipelines
• standing up cloud services to run ML workloads
• automating repeatable routines in ML workflows
• architecting a machine learning system or platform
• leading client projects
• coaching junior team members

If you’re the right Senior Machine Learning Engineer for us, you’ll have:
• an undergraduate degree in maths or... engineering
• fundamental modern software engineering skills (can design and implement a well structured code base and software development cycle, including CI/CD, TDD, monitoring/logging)
• solid programming skills in at least one language, such as Python
• cloud engineering skills to architect, use and deploy cloud services in at least one cloud stack
• an understanding of key machine learning and data science concepts across different areas
• good grasp of concepts in machine learning development cycle & MLOps, such as model development, model deployment, data versioning etc.
• exposure to one or more ML technologies and/or frameworks such as Amazon Sagemaker, Google AI Platform, AI API Services, and/or TensorFlow, Pytorch, Scikit-Learn etc, with demonstrable production experience
• ability to search and evaluate the best tool for a range of different technical problems
• MLOps skills to design, develop and deploy machine learning workflows and standard frameworks
• system design skills to architect, develop and deploy a large-scale machine learning system or platform
• ability to plan and oversee a machine learning project end-to-end with different phases
• great consultant / client skills, and / or the ability to coach junior members in the team
• a genuine passion for and connection to the data science and ML community

Our team is made up of a range of people, with different experience across a huge range of data driven skill sets. We value a diversity of skill-sets, and don’t necessarily require that you’re skilled with all of the above (we’re aware there’s a lot listed!). If you feel you don't fit all the experience/skills listed we still encourage you to apply or get in touch.

Why join us?
• We know you won’t have one job for life. That’s why we’re building a group of companies across Australia and New Zealand where we can support you to take on new skills and challenges. We want to help you develop in your role or diversify your career pathways via alternate brands.
• We want each person to tailor their working conditions whether that be remotely every now and then, or on a permanent basis - we know how to actually do ‘flexibility’ not just talk about it.
• You will get to build your experience and fine tune your skills by working on projects right across Mantel Groups portfolio of clients regardless of where you are based.
• We’re a fast growing progressive company that centres its focus on a people first culture - did we mention we have just ranked #1 in the 2021 Australia’s Best Workplaces list!
• You will help establish our destination hubs in New Zealand and influence and foster the development of its culture.
• We hire smart people and get out of their way. By focusing on our five principles and not getting caught up in red tape, we trust you to get the job done.
• Naturally, you’ll get all the tools you need - a new iPhone or Google phone, a new Macbook Pro or HP Elite, and a lot of branded swag!

Who are we?

Glad you asked! We are Eliiza. Data science. Engineered for scale.

We are a passionate team of data scientists and engineers who apply data science and machine learning to solve real-world problems. Our mission is to create a bright future for businesses and society in a world increasingly influenced by intelligent technologies.

More about us

Mantel Group is an Australian-owned, 'house of brands' company with eight technology businesses; DigIO, Eliiza, Kasna, CMD Solutions, Pretzel Lab, Azenix, Cuusoo & Itty Bitty Apps. Since our inception in 2017, we have grown to a team of over 550 people (aka Mantelorians!) across Australia & New Zealand and have just ranked #1 in the 2021 Australia’s Best Workplaces list!

We've built a hybrid approach to remote working where you can spend time in any (or all!) of our awesome hubs providing a space for collaboration across Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Perth & & Magnetic island, (Auckland & Queenstown - watch this space!) meaning you can choose a work model that works best for you!

We don't have a head office, instead have opted for a distributed and diverse leadership team that extends across Australia and New Zealand. We’re building both support and leadership roles in New Zealand which creates the opportunity for our people to grow, learn and accelerate career development through executing the Mantel Group NZ Strategy.

Keen to chat?

Click “Apply” to share your details with our talent team, and we’ll be in touch.

In the meantime, check out ‘how we hire’ to find out what’s in store if you’re successful and get to know us better by visiting our website and following Eliiza on LinkedIn.

Cuusoo focuses on Big Data, Cloud Data Services, and Data. Their company has offices in Australia and New Zealand. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.cuusoo.com.au

• Management role – Data and Applied Intelligence
• Bring your consulting background in Data and AI
• Opportunity to be based in Auckland or Wellington

Are you an experienced consulting professional with a background in data, people management and solving client problems – this could be the role for you!

About us:

Accenture is a leading global professional services company that helps the world’s leading businesses, governments and other organizations build their digital core, optimize their operations, accelerate revenue growth and enhance citizen services—creating tangible value at speed and scale. We are a talent and innovation led company with 738,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries. Technology is at the core of change today, and we are one of the world’s leaders in helping drive that change, with strong ecosystem relationships. We combine our strength in technology with unmatched industry experience, functional expertise and global delivery capability. We are... uniquely able to deliver tangible outcomes because of our broad range of services, solutions and assets across Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Operations, Industry X and Accenture Song. These capabilities, together with our culture of shared success and commitment to creating 360° value, enable us to help our clients succeed and build trusted, lasting relationships. We measure our success by the 360° value we create for our clients, each other, our shareholders, partners and communities. Learn more about how we are measuring value in all directions with Accenture’s 360° Value Integrated Reporting.

Join our Applied Intelligence team and create innovative, forward thinking and life changing solutions using cutting-edge technologies. We are changing the world fast, come with us. Click here to know more on how we work : Artificial Intelligence (AI) Services & Solutions | Accenture

You'll learn, grow and advance in an innovative culture that thrives on shared success, and diverse ways of thinking and enables boundaryless opportunities that can drive your career in new and exciting ways

The Opportunity:
• You will advise on and head opportunities related to data and Applied Intelligence at existing and prospective clients.
• You will be part of one global network, tapping into the deep expertise of our Applied Intelligence practice and be faced with boundaryless opportunities to excel.
• Drive the growth of your team and build a diverse, entrepreneurial team of professionals with both qualitative and quantitative backgrounds using data-driven and insights-led approaches to respond quickly in a dynamic and ever-changing market
• Work directly with business management and influence them with compelling ideas based on data insights that will exceed business expectations
• Manage multiple projects across a range of industries focusing on providing our clients with evidence-based solutions
• Develop and be in charge of the delivery of communications and reporting to explain the output of work to both internal and client stakeholders
• Mobilize the team to proactively respond to critical situations within an area of expertise (data governance, machine learning, NLP, etc) either internally for Accenture or at client engagements.
• Articulate business impact and benefits of advanced analytics solutions via business/scientific storytelling and advanced visualisation techniques.
• Deliver expertise around language, a component of artificial intelligence that provides computers with the ability to understand human speech as it is spoken.
• Design, build, develop and apply solutions that interpret human speech and translate it into text or commands. Convert audio to text by applying neural network/deep learning models.
• Apply expertise in data science, machine learning and consulting skills in end to end client engagements from ideation, prototyping, solution building to operationalisation

About you:
• Strong background in understanding the importance of data-driven insights and helping clients navigate their journey to being more mature around data and analytics
• Qualifications in Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics or similar areas
• 7+ years of experience in deploying machine learning algorithms in analytics-enabled digital transformations.
• 3+ years in a people management role
• Core Technical Skills:
• Natural Language Understanding, Conversational (Virtual Agent) solution and Narrative Science
• Speech to text, Text to speech etc
• Computer vision, face recognition, handwriting recognition etc
• Apache Spark, Microsoft Azure Machine Learning, Mathematical Programming,etc

Company DescriptionKo wai mātou | About us    Ko tō mātou kaupapa nui ko te tuku atu i tō mātou pūngao ki te wāhi e tika ana, kia whakahaukino kore ai i te rāngai pūngao o Aotearoa me te whakatairanga atu i te #changematters. E kaingākau ana mātou mō tō mātou whāinga matua, ā, e whakahīhī ana anō mātou i te iwi tangata kei muri i a mātou e whaiwhai ana i te whāinga kotahi. Nā runga i tēnei whāinga teitei, tērā pea ka ui ake koe ki a koe anōka pēhea tēnei āheinga e tautoko ana i tētehi Aotearoa pai ake, Aotearoa mā ake? Our purpose is to put our energy where it matters, to decarbonise the New Zealand energy sector and promote #changematters. We are passionate about our mission and proud to have a tribe of people behind us working towards a common purpose. With such an ambitious goal, you might ask yourself – how does this opportunity help support a better, cleaner NZ? Contact is transforming its business with a data-first focus on operational excellence, enabling our team to do their... best. Delivering this transformation will require Contact to strengthen its technology, data, and delivery capabilities, adopt new ways of working and shape its culture for greater agility, innovation, and customer obsession Job DescriptionTe Whiwhinga mahi | The opportunity  We are on a journey to lift our organisational data capability to enable our people to do what they do best – deliver amazing customer experiences, create growth, and increase the value of our business. You’ll be part of a data team working with business stakeholders to deliver these outcomes.   Our data platform is an integral component of our technology and business strategy, and we continue to evolve and scale our platform. It is an exciting time right now as we are growing exponentially, and you’ll get to be a part of designing and delivering this next phase of our data evolution.   As a Data Engineer you’ll work in a data product squad, your key task being to design, build and deliver beautiful data products and insights to our business. Technical leads and the broader data team will be there to support you along the way.  QualificationsWe’re really big on collaboration so this type of environment will suit you well. You're a problem solver at heart who embraces challenging problems in the data world.  Additionally, you’ll be unfazed by a fast-changing complex environment and have a passion for continuous improvement and delivering the right solution for our business.  Here’s some technical skills we’ll be searching for in your application; (i.e., when have you…) Designed and deployed data pipelines and solutions in complex environments, including emerging data technologies Applied critical thinking skills to identify and resolve data and platform issues Data transformation (ELT/ETL) using a range of structured and unstructured sources to create data that works for a variety of use cases Used source code control (Git) and extensive knowledge of the SDLC and contemporary tools, practices, and expectations Open-source data and cloud platforms/services, preferably AWS, Spark Programming, preferably Python Additional skills and experience are highly beneficial, including e.g., DataOps, windows/Linux administration and security. Additional InformationThere are a bunch of perks to being a permanent Contact kaimahi (employee). Along with great leadership, teammates, development, and growth and progression opportunities, you’ll enjoy flexible working, free health insurance cover, better-than-your-average leave, access to Contact Shares, a ‘Good to be Home’ annual payment toward your home set up & wellbeing, discounts on Contact Energy products, and more.We’re keen to welcome a new Data Engineer soon so if this sounds like a bit of you, apply now, or if there’s something you’re curious to know before making it official, contact George on george.bevan@contactenergy.co.nz.Please note, only candidates with the right to live and work in New Zealand will be considered for this role.Research shows that while men apply to jobs where they meet 60% of the criteria, women and those in underrepresented groups tend to only apply if they tick every box. We're not about box ticking, so if you think you have what it takes but don't meet everything stated above, please still get in touch. We'd love to kōrero

Join a growing and ambitious data analytic consultancy that are helping companies to leverage their data to make smarter, more informed business decisions.
• Supported by a strong leadership team with combined 30 years of experience
• Learn new skills and improve on your existing ones with cutting edge tech
• Expand your own network and work with top clients across NZ

About the role :

Depending on where you specialise in, you could be involved in engineering cloud-based data platforms, creating predictive models using machine learning and AI, or displaying beautiful custom BI dashboards for clients to enable informed data driven decision making.

Ideally you will have a base level understanding across all of these and be a specialist in one area. You will be seen as a thought leader to their clients on how they can best utilise their data.

About YOU :
• You are a top data professional across any of these disciplines including Data Engineering, Data Science, Data Analysts, and... Business Intelligence.
• You will have a T-shaped skillset, with a breadth of knowledge across many disciplines but one that you are an expert in.
• Having a continuous learning mindset and a passion for growing a flourishing and successful organisation.
• You will demonstrate an outstanding academic record, especially if you have little experience.
• Communication is key, as you will be translating complex data into actionable insights to allow companies to make key decisions using their data
• You have a solid understanding of cloud technologies across either GCP, AWS, or Azure
• A background using SAS, Python, R and Power BI

About the organisation :

The organisation is a growing team of 15 data professionals across several disciplines who need people-resources to meet their client's needs - they are so busy they are having to turn away work.

Based in a new office in Auckland, they have fostered an enviable team culture where learning, collaboration and innovation sits at the heart of everything they do.

Hybrid working is supported in this role, but candidates will preferably be based in Auckland.

Interested? Give John a call on 021 839 812 for a confidential discussion and to find out more about the opportunity

Altered State Machine (ASM) are looking for world-class AI Researchers to work on our Product Feature Track. We are welcoming applicants from anywhere in the world.

As part of the Innovation team you will work in applying novel deep learning models towards designing the next generation of AI generative features. You will use the models invented by the Core AI Research team, and any open-sourced AI projects from the rest of the world, e.g. stable diffusion to build advanced AI features.

ASM are creating the world’s first protocol for decentralised and democratised Artificial Intelligence, owned and traded using NFTs, and interoperable across the Metaverse. Our protocol enables anyone to own AI, and the machine learning models that define what it learns over time. These are paired with artwork in the form of NFT's to create non-player agents.

We're creating a world where everyone can own, understand, trust and benefit from their AI. Join us in building the #OpenMetaverse. Help to... push the boundaries of future innovation.

Key responsibilities:
• Implement, and evaluate models and software prototypes.
• Report and present research findings and developments, including status and results, clearly and efficiently, both internally and externally, verbally and in writing.
• Work with external collaborators and maintain relationships with relevant labs and partners and key stakeholders as appropriate.

Requirements

In order to set you up for success as an AI Researcher at ASM, we look for the following skills and experience:
• M.S. / Ph.D. in a related area, e.g. Computer Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence.
• Practical experience in AI models, e.g. transformers, diffusion models, VAE/GAN.
• Real passion and experience in AI generative area

Benefits

We're a great place to work at
• Experienced and wickedly talented team and growing
• Venture funded by a consortium of leading crypto investors… and more every day
• Plenty of opportunity
• Real work-life balance

We can offer
• Great variety (no two days are the same)
• Exciting international projects
• Engaging with global AAA gaming companies, game platforms and investors
• The right salary
• Flexibility with WFH options
• The chance to be part of the next generation of the internet… the decentralised Metaverse

We’re looking for people to help us build the future of AI and gaming in Web3. If the above sounds like you and the idea of new technologies, gaming and the Metaverse excites you, we’d love to chat

• Great company culture where staff are valued and supported
• Opportunity to be part of an amazing tight-knit team
• Great career move in new year
• Excellent benefits, hybrid working model.
• Full time permanent opportunity based in Auckland CBD

Auckland Unlimited combines the power of Auckland’s cultural richness with our successful destination management and economic development programmes. We are New Zealand’s largest producer of cultural, entertainment, sporting and wildlife experiences, and the largest regional economic development agency in the country. Our work touches all Aucklanders and visitors to our region, creating a legacy for future generations. To know more about what we do and what’s on in Auckland visit our website: https://aucklandunlimited.com/

He angitūtanga: The opportunity

We are hiring an intermediate Data Engineer who is very enthusiastic about data to focus on building structured, high-quality data solutions which we use to evolve our data products.

In... this role you will support the Data Architecture stream in ensuring Auckland Unlimited strategic goals are optimised by evolving effective Enterprise Data Management using enterprise data standards for data warehousing, data lake, data management and other corporate databases.

The key for this role is to unlock the value of data within the organisation by providing expertise, platforms, and capabilities.

Click here to access the position description.

He kōrero mōu: About you

You will have excellent written and verbal communication skills, including a high level of problem solving and decision-making skills, using professional judgement. You will also bring:
• 3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer
• Technical expertise with data models, data mining, and segmentation techniques
• Hands-on experience with data manipulation and programming languages (e.g., SQL, Java, and Python)
• Hands-on experience with SQL database design
• Great numerical and analytical skills
• Working experience with on-premises, Azure cloud hosted data management platforms
• Knowledge and understanding of both batch and fast-moving data paradigms
• Good knowledge of one or more data warehousing applications that may include Oracle, PL/SQL, Microsoft SQL, and Azure Data Platform technologies
• Well versed with various data modelling techniques and design principles
• Possess strong creative and analytical problem-solving skills around computation, interpretation, and presentation of data intelligence for decision making
• Knowledge of Machine Learning, data mining and AI principles applied to data patterns recognition resolving data driven problems
• Knowledge and experience working with NoSQL data management platforms such as MongoDB, Hadoop, Cassandra, MapReduce etc
• Experience working with various types of data sources – structured, semi-structured, non-structured.

We are looking for candidates with these preferred technical skills:
• Azure Data Factory (Synapse Pipeline)
• Azure Synapse (Apache Spark/Delta lake), Azure SQL DB, or Databricks
• Azure Data-lake Storage
• Python
• SQL
• JSON Knowledge
• Rest API Knowledge
• Kimball Methodology
• Medallion Architecture

Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer

So, what’s in it for you? Here at TAU, we pride ourselves on providing work life balance and inclusive work environment. In addition to awesome colleagues and work culture we also offer the following benefits:
• Flexible working – work from home options
• Auckland council benefits (e.g., discounted rates to Auckland council pools & Leisure centers etc)
• Strong mentoring & career development focus

You also get to contribute to Auckland’s growth, enriching cultural and economic life in Tāmaki Makaurau by creating and sharing experiences and opportunities. If you have a genuine desire to be part of the journey in creating a wonderful experience and positive outcome for Auckland, then please apply now by submitted your CV and cover letter expressing your interest!

All applications must be made online. If you require assistance or support through the application process, please contact us at recruitment@aucklandunlimited.com.

Applications close: 31 January 2023. Applications will be reviewied as they are received, so early submissions are encouraged.

Tātaki Auckland Unlimited is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.

Tātaki Auckland Unlimited strongly encourages our employees to be fully vaccinated

At Eliiza we’re creating a Data and Analytics practice (brand new team!) and we are searching for a Senior Data Consultant (Data & Analytics) to join. The Data and Analytics proposition sits across four key areas: Data Strategy, Machine Learning and Data Science Strategy, Data Governance and Data Storytelling.

As a Senior Data Consultant with Eliiza you will work across the consulting and delivery areas of our business. The consulting aspect of the role will involve helping to define business problems that are based on data and shaping them into defined projects. Delivery will require managing these projects and building good relationships through stakeholder reporting and client engagement. The role will always be focused on working towards positive outcomes.

Working within a new practice you will help create the most prominent brand in the market associated with data offerings.

So you’re ready for something new?

Along with a diverse range of clients and projects, we guarantee... you’ll have the opportunity to work with some of the best data scientists, ML engineers and developers in the industry (from across all of Mantel Group).
No two days will look the same - but here’s a great snapshot of some of your responsibilities:

If you’re the right Senior Data Consultant for us, you’ll have:
• a strong background in working on data projects in commercial environments, and are able to manage projects with many moving parts
• solid experience in technical writing and are able to prepare clear documentation for a range of audiences
• solid experience working within a consultancy environment
• the ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders at different levels of technical detail
• an adaptable approach and methods based on project and customer needs, are comfortable with ambiguity and can provide guidance on scope and direction
• some hands-on technical skills - data science is at the heart of what we do after all! This will allow you to carry out or supervise exploratory data analysis. Experience with SQL and/or BI tools such as PowerBI and Tableau is preferable, and basic understanding of a data science language such as R or Python is a plus!
• exposure to ML/AI and cloud technologies is desirable, but an ability to familiarise yourself with new technologies and tools is more important
• strong time management skills with ability to prioritise workloads under pressure and meet deadlines
• a self-starting attitude, be hands on, and know how to find answers and work with ambiguity
• a values driven and practical approach
a genuine passion for and connection to the data science and analytics community

Why join us?
• We know you won’t have one job for life. That’s why we’re building a group of companies across Australia and New Zealand where we can support you to take on new skills and challenges. We want to help you develop in your role or diversify your career pathways via alternate brands.
• We want each person to tailor their working conditions whether that be remotely every now and then, or on a permanent basis - we know how to actually do ‘flexibility’ not just talk about it.
• You will get to build your experience and fine tune your skills by working on projects right across Mantel Groups portfolio of clients regardless of where you are based.
• We’re a fast growing progressive company that centres its focus on a people first culture - did we mention we have just ranked #1 in the 2021 Australia’s Best Workplaces list!
• You will help establish our destination hubs in New Zealand and influence and foster the development of its culture.
• We hire smart people and get out of their way. By focusing on our five principles and not getting caught up in red tape, we trust you to get the job done.
• Naturally, you’ll get all the tools you need - a new iPhone or Google phone, a new laptop, and a lot of branded swag!

Who are we?

Glad you asked! We are Eliiza - We Dig Data.

We are a passionate team of data scientists and engineers who apply data science and machine learning to solve real-world problems. Our mission is to create a bright future for businesses and society in a world increasingly influenced by intelligent technologies.

More about us:

Mantel Group is an Australian-owned, 'house of brands' company with technology businesses; DigIO, Eliiza, Kasna, CMD Solutions, Pretzel Lab, Azenix, Cuusoo, Itty Bitty Apps & Aginic. We may be only 5 years old but we have already have ranked #1 in the 2021 & 2022 Australia’s Best Workplaces list!

We've built a hybrid approach to remote working where you can spend time in any (or all!) of our awesome hubs providing a space for collaboration across Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane Perth, Magnetic island & Auckland meaning you can choose a work model that works best for you!

We don't have a head office, instead have opted for a distributed and diverse leadership team that extends across Australia and New Zealand. We’re building both support and leadership roles in New Zealand which creates the opportunity for our people to grow, learn and accelerate career development through executing the Mantel Group NZ Strategy.

#LI-DNI

It's official! Eliiza has ranked as No 1 Best Workplace in Australia for 2 years in a row! (as part of Mantel Groups house of brands - named Best Medium sized workplace 2021 & 2022!).

Eliiza is jam packed full of passionate data lovers! Our team consists of Data Consultant, Machine Learning Engineers, Data Engineers & Data Scientists all working together to deliver smart data and analytics solutions for our clients.

Our team members are located all around Australia and New Zealand and we dont mind where you are located (within Australia & New Zealand). We've built a hybrid approach to working where you can access any (or all!) of our awesome hubs providing a space for collaboration across Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Perth, Magnetic island & Auckland (and more to come!) meaning you can choose a work model (and location!) that works best for you and your individual needs!

We don't have a head office, instead have opted for a distributed and diverse leadership team that extends... across Australia and New Zealand.

Our approach is simple; we hire smart people and get out of their way. We don’t do policies, performance reviews, hierarchies or bureaucracy! By focusing on our five principles and not getting caught up in red tape, we trust you to get the job done.

So you’re ready for something new?

The Data and Analytics practice is a brand new team at Eliiza. We will be setting out to help our clients solve a broader set of analytics problems, which will complement both our expertise in ML and AI in Eliiza and our broader Mantel Group solutions.

The Data and Analytics proposition sits across four key areas: Data Strategy, Machine Learning and Data Science Strategy, Data Governance and Data Storytelling. You will be instrumental in supporting the successful delivery of projects, helping build our reputation as one of the most impactful consultancies in the Data and Analytics space.

With our diverse range of clients and projects, no day will look the same - but here’s a little snapshot of how you could spend your day:
• working to quickly gain understanding of our clients’ data environment and culture to assess their data management capabilities and establish where they are at in their data journey
• using your strong data management and strategy background, provide recommendations and options in uplifting the clients’ data management capabilities
• with ease you will interact with both business and technical teams to understand how well-designed data governance framework can add values
• working with regulators and internal teams in analysing gaps, proposing solution options and establishing roadmap to close out any audit items
• Assist the clients in selecting the right tools and vendors and delivering proof of concepts / values in support of business case and procurement process
• Advise clients on the best approach to expand data management capabilities to include privacy & ethics, data security or master data management

If you’re the right Senior Consultant - Data Governance for us, you will have:
• hands on experience developing and maintaining a data governance framework along with articulating and demonstrating the benefits to both business and technical teams
• strong understanding of key data management concepts such as data quality, master data, metadata management & lineage, data architecture, data modelling and privacy & security
• developed understanding of these concepts above through hands-on experience (desirable)
• good understanding of a modern data platform and its various components such as data lakes, data pipelines / ETL, data warehousing, business intelligence and data science
• familiarity with one or more of these data management toolsets: metadata management and lineage, data quality or master data management.
• hands on experience developing data strategy in a large organisation or as part of a transformation program (desirable)
• consulting experience, either with external clients or internally within an organisation
• an analytical mind, keen attention to detail and not afraid to ask “why?”
• self-starter attitude, hands on approach, know how to find answers and can work with ambiguity

Our team is made up of a range of people, with different experience across a huge range of data driven skill sets. We value a diversity of skill-sets, and don’t necessarily require that you’re skilled with all of the above. If you feel you don't fit all the experience/skills listed we still encourage you to apply or get in touch.

What's on offer/ Why Eliiza?
• We make sure you’re always one step ahead by investing your learning and development, every year. We build our own training where it doesn’t exist yet - it’s in our best interest to teach you things you don’t already know.
• You and your family’s health are most important to us. We know everyone is walking their own path in life, so we offer Flexible Leave for those times in your life when you need extra support.
• We want each person to tailor their working conditions whether that be remotely every now and then, or on a permanent basis - we know how to actually do ‘flexibility’ not just talk about it.
• You’ll be joining a passionate and supportive team who’ll move mountains to help you achieve your objective.
• You’ll get all the tools you need - including the latest phone & laptop along with mobile & data allowance and a lot of swag!

But hold on, you mentioned a house of brands?

We certainly did! Mantel Group is an Australian-owned, 'house of brands' company with technology businesses (Eliiza being one of them!) across Australia and New Zealand. We know you won’t have one job for life so we’re building a group of companies with open borders so we can support you to take on new skills and challenges without leaving an awesome team!

Being part of Mantel Group means it’s not just the Eliiza team you’ll work with, learn from and see at social events - there’s another bunch of us across DigIO, Kasna, CMD Solutions, Pretzel lab, Azenix, Cuusoo, Itty Bitty Apps & Aginic!

Sounds like a good match for you?
